artist: Artist: Katsukawa Shun'ei; Publisher: Kagaya Kichiemon
creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
markings: Censor seal: 極 {kiwame}; publisher\'s seal: 吉 {Kagaya Kichibē}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
text: Takasago Uraemon (died 1829) fought under this from 1809 until 1821 when he became Tegarayama Shigeemon for one last tournament before his retirement. It is unclear when this portrait was made that shows him dressed like a samurai, carrying two swords.
title: The Sumo Wrestler Takasago Uraemon
